THE LAWNMOWER MAN Special Features:

Disc 1 – Theatrical Cut:

NEW 4K scan of the interpositive

NEW Cybergod: Creating The Lawnmower Man – featuring interviews with co-writer/director Brett Leonard, actor Jeff Fahey, editor Alan Baumgarten, make-up effects artist Michael Deak and special effects coordinator Frank Ceglia

Audio Commentary with writer/director Brett Leonard and writer/producer Gimel Everett

Deleted Scenes

Original Electronic Press Kit with cast interviews and behind-the-scenes footage

Edited animated sequences

Theatrical Trailer

TV Spot

Disc 2 – Director’s Cut:

NEW 4K scan of the interpositive with additional “director’s cut” footage from the original camera negative

Audio Commentary with writer/director Brett Leonard and writer/producer Gimel Everett

Conceptual art and Design sketches

Behind the scenes and production stills

Storyboard Comparison

Audio Specs : DTS-HD Master Audio 2.0/5.1

THE LAWNMOWER MAN Collector’s Edition 2-Disc Blu-ray rundown via press release:

A world where the normal course of events could suddenly turn inside out — the imaginary becomes real, and reality is all in your mind. Loyal fans of visionary filmmaker Brett Leonard (Virtuosity, Hideaway) know well the enthralling sci-fi action horror from his 1992 cult classic THE LAWNMOWER MAN, starring Jeff Fahey (Machete) and Pierce Brosnan (The Son). Directed by Brett Leonard (Virtuosity, Hideaway), the film also stars Jenny Wright (Near Dark) and Geoffrey Lewis (The Devil’s Rejects). On June 20, 2017, SCREAM FACTORY™ Home Entertainment is proud to present THE LAWNMOWER MAN Collector’s Edition. Available for the first time on Blu-ray, this definitive collector’s edition release boasts The Director’s Cut, theatrical cut and revealing extras. A must-have for movie collectors, sci-fi enthusiasts and loyal fans, THE LAWNMOWER MAN Collector’s Edition 2-Disc Blu-ray set also includes a collectible slipcover featuring newly rendered artwork and a reversible cover wrap featuring original theatrical key art.

Avid fans and collectors please take not: Order from ShoutFactory.com and get a FREE 18" X 24" poster featuring our brand new artwork, available while supplies last! Also get it shipped Two Weeks early!

THE LAWNMOWER MAN synopsis:

Dr. Lawrence Angelo (Pierce Brosnan) is a brilliant scientist obsessed with perfecting virtual reality software. When his experiments on animals fail, he finds the ideal substitute – Jobe Smith (Jeff Fahey), a slow-witted gardener. Dr. Angelo's goal is to benefit his human guinea pig and ultimately mankind itself, but evil lurks the guise of "the Shop," a shadowy group that seeks to use the technology to create an invincible war machine. When the experiments change the simple Jobe into a superhuman being, the stage is set for a Jekyll-and-Hyde struggle for the control of Jobe's mind and the future of the world.

THE LAWNMOWER MAN was directed by Brett Leonard from a script by Leonard and Gimel Everett. The film stars Pierce Brosnan, Jeff Fahey, Jenny Wright and Geoffrey Lewis.

The film hits Blu-ray June 20th. You can pre-order the film on Blu-ray from Amazon

Lastly this month is the Blu-ray debut of a 90's sci-fi cult classic, The Lawnmower Man. Jeff Fahey plays Jobe Smith, a simple-minded gardener taken in by a scientist, Dr. Angelo (Pierce Brosnan) who uses Jobe as a guinea pig for a new intelligence enhancing drug. But as the treatments progress and Jobe becomes smarter, Dr. Angelo starts to lose control of the experiment as Jobe becomes something more than human.

The Lawnmower Man, while full of very dated special effects now, is still an incredibly fun sci-fi/horror yarn. Fahey is great in the role of Jobe playing him brilliantly as both a childlike gardener and a powerful villain. Brosnan is great as always and Brett Leonard's direction is solid with great pacing and a strong story arc. This new Blu-ray contains the original theatrical cut as well as the much better director's cut, both with new 4K transfers. This one is well worth revisiting even if it was from the dawn of CG with some questionable visuals. They still work within the context of the story though and make The Lawnmower Man worthy of its cult classic status.
